block.p: Amy Alexander Kershaw, a daughter of Dr. Nancy L. Goldner of Brooklyn and the late David N. Kershaw, was married yesterday to Adrien Claude Finzi, a son of Anna and Bernard Finzi of Princeton, N.J. Paula Gilmure, a justice of the peace in Brewster, Mass., officiated at the High Brewster, an inn there.

Ms. Kershaw, 32, is keeping her name. She is the director of research and policy for Early Education for All, a privately financed project in Boston. She graduated from Williams College and received a master's degree in public administration from Syracuse University. Her mother is a psychotherapist in Brooklyn. The bride's father was a founder of Mathematica Policy Research, a company that conducts public policy research and surveys in Princeton. The bride is a stepdaughter of Sharon Worthington.

Amy Alexander Kershaw, a daughter of Dr. Nancy L. Goldner of Brooklyn and the late David N. Kershaw, was married yesterday to Adrien Claude Finzi, a son of Anna and Bernard Finzi of Princeton, N.J. Paula Gilmure, a justice of the peace in Brewster, Mass., officiated at the High Brewster, an inn there.

Ms. Kershaw, 32, is keeping her name. She is the director of research and policy for Early Education for All, a privately financed project in Boston. She graduated from Williams College and received a master's degree in public administration from Syracuse University. Her mother is a psychotherapist in Brooklyn. The bride's father was a founder of Mathematica Policy Research, a company that conducts public policy research and surveys in Princeton. The bride is a stepdaughter of Sharon Worthington.

Mr. Finzi, also 32, is an assistant professor of biology at Boston University. A graduate of the University of New Hampshire, he received a master's degree in statistics and a Ph.D. in biology from the University of Connecticut at Storrs. His father is the senior vice president for international technology at the Instinet Corporation, an electronic stock-brokerage and trading network in Manhattan.
Although the couple met at Princeton High School, they did not begin dating until after seeing each other at their class's 10-year reunion.
